Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Reliable; Easy To Set Up; Durable construction; Easy To Use
Cons: Large Footprint
The printer is used essentially only for photo production. The ability to handle multiple paper types and sizes is a big plus. I set up for a MacPro OS 10.6.x with WiFi and really quite easy to get the printer entered to my Mac. The paper selection process when printing was not initially intuitive, but once understood, it was easy to select different papers. I print from Lightroom 1.2 and iPhoto; currently Lightroom's profiles produce a darker image, but I am working with Lightroom to correct that.
This is the printer for you if your focus is on photos. If you are looking to print color documents, I recommend a different Epson printer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Set Up; Compact Design
Cons: Slow Print Time; Too much ink used
I like Epson printers. The Epson R3000 Printer is my fourth Epson Printer. I started out with a 1280 model, moved to a 1800 model (loved that glossy look) and then went to a 2880 because I wanted to do Black & White, which I thought the 2880 did superbly. But my 2880 rear paper feed never really worked with any consistency and when the pump and other noises began to make me think that the old 2880 was on its last legs I decided to spring for the R3000 rather than take the risk that a new 2880 would simply have the same rear paper feed problems. Plus, Epson advertised that the R3000 offered better color, so I went for it. Installation & set up of the 3000 went well. There have been a ... few changes but nothing big and if you have used Epson printers previously you should not have any problems. Printing with the Top Sheet feeder is basically the same as the other Epson products. There has been a redesign in the way that thick "Fine Art" paper is installed. Rather than feed these papers through the rear as in previous designs, the Fine Art Paper is now inserted through a paper tray in the front where the printer grabs it, feeds it through to the rear where the machine aligns it prior to feeding the paper back into the printer it to make the print. I found the directions for this process rather opaque in the owner's manual and had to call Epson for explanation which Epson provided without any problem. Once you get the feel for the process things go fine, but the process requires you to follow explicit prompts on the screen in the front of the printer. This process takes time though, the machine is in control, it takes its time and you cannot hurry it. The good news is that there have no paper jams. I have not yet decided on the print quality. I have printed everything on Level 4 Quality. The first prints I made on Cold Press paper seemed to have a little more vividness but it is hard to tell. The monochrome prints I have made do not seem to have the great tonal values that I got with the 2880, but that may be a case of me getting used to the machine. The negative comment I have is Ink Consumption. The R3000 seems to suck up ink like the desert sands absorb water. Ink consumption is definitely much higher with the R3000 than the 2880. My preliminary estimate is that consumption is up by as much as 50%. I am going to have to reduce the number of casual prints I make with this machine simply because of this increase in ink consumption. The prints are nice though. Except for the consumption issue I am pleased with my printer but if you are considering a purchase think about how you will be using the machine. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I definitely recommend this printer to anyone who needs to print great quality prints! I am a graphic artist. I use my printer to send proofs to my customers. I have gotten many complements on the look of the proofs. I'm also a mixed media artist and I use this printer for high quality prints to use in my artwork. Prints beautifully! Crisp and clear. Seems to work best on Epson papers. In my opinion this is the best printer you can buy for printing quality prints.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: A great printer that was very easy to set up for wireless connection with my iMAC. I have been looking for a photo printer that would produce rich black and white photos and have not been disappointed. Scanned in some old black and white negatives and was very impressed with the output compared to the wet chemical prints I had made in a darkroom.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Durable construction; Easy To Setup; Easy To Use
Cons: Too much ink used
The jury is still out. So far my prints look great. After only 7 5x7 prints the ink levels have dropped 30%. I was told this printer ships with full cartridges but maybe this isn't the case. I'm hoping the ink meters on the front of the printer are not acurate. If they are I'll be investing another $300 in ink by the end of the week.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Easy To Set Up; Reliable
Cons: Slow Print Time; Too much ink used
Great quality color prints on any paper! Absolutely great results! If you like the control of printing your own photos and controlling your time, this is a the best! My only complaint is the amount of black ink it consumes as it switches between Matte & Photo black.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: My Pick for Perfect Prosumer Printer
Item.Review: At school I've been using an Epson Stylus Pro 3880 and have gotten kind of addicted to printing my photos. The R3000 is half the cost and almost exactly the same except for it's narrower 13 maximum print width (vs the 17 3880). Both use the UltraChrome K3 with Vivid Magenta ink set which is the same one used by almost all of Epson's Pro line of printers. Honestly, I don't know why the R3000 isn't in their Pro line since it could reasonably be used by a pro who never needed to print anything wider than 13.I printed some color test charts at the [@] photo lab (which should be reasonable quality since they actually calibrate their printers at least once a day and when they change paper rolls) and on my R3000, then compared them to an actual X-Rite produced ColorChecker chart, and the output f ... rom the R3000 significantly beats the output from [@] Fuji Frontier minilab photo printer. The Fuji Frontier print is noticeably duller with generally darker colors and a narrower range of saturated color reproduction. You don't have to be a color expert to see the difference.For the R3000 the ink cost is about $1/ml which comes out to about $0.01 per square inch if you get it at a discount (search for red river Cost of Inkjet Printing Epson R3000). That makes a borderless 8x10 cost about $0.80 in ink, and a borderless 8.5x11 cost about $1 in ink. A sheet of Epson Ultra Premium Photo paper costs as little as $0.60 if you get it at a discount, so printing a borderless 8.5x11 ends up costing as little as $1.60 in supplies. (Not to mention that you can get third-party paper that's just as good or better than Epson's official paper for less money.)The cheapest photo labs charge around $1.50 for an 8x10 (my local [@] currently charges $1.46). If we use a whole 8.5x11 sheet of official paper and a full 8x10 worth of ink to print an 8x10, we get $1.40 in supplies per 8x10 which is slightly cheaper than even [@] and significantly higher quality. Good third-party paper would be around $0.35/sheet meaning that you could also do as well as $1.15 per 8x10, maybe even better.Admittedly though that doesn't incorporate the cost of the printer, which you won't have to incur if you just use a photo lab. If you bought the printer for say $800 and you've gotten your per-8x10 supply costs down to $1.15, then you'd need to print about 2,580 8x10's before your total costs started to get lower than [@]'s $1.46.When you get larger than 8x10 though then the printer really starts to pay off. One place online that isn't too expensive and has a good reputation charges $6.30 for a 12x18 on glossy photo paper printed with a photographic lab process. It's possible to get decent 13x19 gloss ink jet photo paper (same stuff that costs $0.35/sheet for the 8.5x11) for about $1.50/sheet. 12x18 of ink costs you $2.16 so total cost for a 12x18 on the R3000 with that paper is $3.66. At that price you need to print 300 or so of these large prints before your prints start costing less than $6.30, and again the ink jet prints may have better quality than the photographic process printer depending on who's doing the printing and with what.You also have the entire lifetime of the printer to make all these prints that we're talking about. If you make on average about 10 8x10 prints every week then it would take about 5 years to make this cost back, but if you made two of the 12x18 prints per week then it would take about 2.8 years to brake even compared to the lower quality photographic process prints ordered from most places online.But none of these estimates take into account the value of the convenience and additional quality you get from having a modern photo inkjet printer right in front of you. Add in costs like transportation to pick up photos, time spent driving, any sort of cost of inconvenience by having to wait for prints to arrive in the mail, the additional value of better color quality, and other hard to quantify things then the real savings may be better. Depending on how much these costs add to the cost of photo lab prints, a decent ink jet printer like this... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Absolutely great results! If you like the control of printing your own photos and controlling your time, this is a great printer! No sending files off to wait for their return and hoping it's the look you want. Epson has done really well with providing ICC profiles so that there is next to no trial and error wasting paper and ink. It does use a lot of ink, but the results require this so it is not an issue. If I just want quick photos for friends to throw in a drawer or put on the fridge, use an inexpensive consumer item. But if you want stunning photos and realistic colors with breaking the bank too much then buy this printer!

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: The printer seems to work well, setup was easy and my initial prints look great. One issue is that the printer comes out of the box with the default setting on photoblack, and it is not easy to change this. A few blogs on the subject but I have not been able to figue it out on my IMAC. You can change the defaults on the front panel of the printer but they do not stay once the printer is turned off then on again.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Durable construction; Easy To Set Up; Easy To Use; Reliable; Compact Design; Fast Print Time; Low Ink Consumption
Printer is a one of the best epson printers. No problems and prints amazing photos. Wifi is easy to setup.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Quality printer at an affordable price
Item.Review: I use this product to print 8x10's. I print between 10-20 per day and enjoy the right colors in the printouts. The R3000 consumes a fair amount of ink and requires the 5 star Epson paper to display glossy professional images.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I purchased this product to replace my old Epson 2200. I use the printer primarily to print note cards on cotton rag papers, and the image quality is very good. Before purchasing the printer I called Epson pre-sales support to see if the printer supported custom sizes for all paper selections, and I was told that it does. I now know that that affirmation was in error, and I have to trick the printer to print on my note card stock, just as I did on the 2200. No improvement there! Loading fine art paper in this printer is more difficult than it was with the 2200;another area where the new model is no improvement. I also used my Epson 2200 for general office printing: Letters, envelopes, labels, and etc. The R3000 does not print envelopes! This was a surprise, and a disappointm ... ent. Evidently Epson planned for this printer to be a photo printer only. The printer does nice B&W prints, but changing black inks still wastes time and ink. I knew that going in, so no complaint other then the fact that Epson cannot seem to get this done efficiently. I rated the printer four stars because the print quality is very good, and I like the wireless connection. The B&W is especially good. If you are looking for a photo printer only, the R3000 may be a good choice for you. If you need a printer that will primarily be used for photo prints, but also want to use it for general office printing you may want to look elsewhere. Although I would recommend this printer to a friend, I would do so only if they understood that this machine is for photos only. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: i use this printer for home photos,excellent results pictures are exactly the same as of it is on the computer. i have printed 8.5 by 11 and they are great i do not know about bigger size. it takes a while to warm up when i turn it on and little slow. other wise great printer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I purchased the Epson R3000 to replace my aging R1800. The R1800 would produce great color prints but would fail on B&W prints. I'm happy to report that the R3000 produces exhibition quality B&W prints that are neutral in tone which is exactly what I was looking for. I'm somewhat missing the gloss optimizer ink from my R1800 that is not present in the R3000. The R3000 has both photo black and matte black ink cartridges that do not require physical swapping, but does require flushing. I recently did a print which required a switch between gloss and matte ink. In the print dialogue it will pop up an error telling you that black ink is incorrect which requires you to go to the printer's LCD menu interface to switch the black inks. Once flushing is complete (3 minutes or less) the prin ... ting will commence. There were some hickups with the R3000 not recognizing the the correct ink cartridges asking me to check the black cartridges so I had to pop them in and out which solved the problem. The correct cartridges were in the right place, so I'm not sure if this is a bug with the the printer. The footprint is rather large but as other reviewers have pointed out, since it has wifi and is networkable you can place the printer in a different room. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I have not had the product long, but have used with normal luster paper, semi-gloss, exhibition fiber, and canvas. Once I read the directions on how to print, everything fell into place. Setup was simple and very straight forward. Only negative is the time and extra ink required for the printer to automatically change from photo black to matte black and back. If using different papers, it is better to plan ahead to save ink.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I have a small commercial photography business and was tired of having good printers not up tp fairly routine tasks or failing after a few months. This printer charged out of the starting blocks and never looked back. It is easy to set up and operate. Customer service from the manufacturer is exceptional.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Best printer I have ever used.
Item.Review: This printer works. It is a big, heavy serious printer and produces beautiful large prints. I have not had it very long, but I am really excited about the performance. It produces prints that have the look of those I used to make in the darkroom. Using the Epson Exhibition Fiber Paper, I have been amazed. It makes good prints on lesser papers as well. I have yet to use it with other of the Epson Pro Papers. It took a few minutes to set up the first time I printed but the directions are clear.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I use this printer to make archival photo prints. I usually print with Canson Photographique Rag and Canson Baryta papers. I'm finding I prefer the rag for color and the baryta for black and white. The quality is great. I especially love the black and white. The only reason I give four stars instead of five is because of the switching that needs to take place between the photo black and matte black inks when switching paper types. It does seem to drink the ink, but that seems to be a common complaint with all of the high end pigment printers, and I knew of this before I bought it, so no unexpected surprises. If I could, I would rate it 4.5 stars. I'm happy with the purchase and it's what I expected.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: The caveat here is that I've only had this a short time- a couple of weeks- ergo I cannot speak to longevity. What this printer has done is produce some very lovely prints both on paper that Epson requires and other papers which I found to produce a print more to my liking. As far as ink usage,sure it uses ink but not any more than I would expect considering I'm covering a letter size piece of paper with ink. I would not use this printer for everyday printing of text or other mundane material, photos only. Also, I experienced absolutely no problems using this printer wirelessly. My only negative comment is that the printer is unable to discern if paper is fed correctly and will print on nothing which creates a problem. However the fix there is to simply be careful and follow the instructi ... ons explicitly. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I use my R3000 to print CADS for apparel and accessiories, and it works great. Wonderful clear prints with outstanding vivid color. It is fast, and requires very little manual labor.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Set Up; Easy To Use
I bought this printer so that I could make good black and white photos. I have been very satisfied. Color is also excellent.
It was remarkably easy to set up and to use.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I've been wanting to purchase a beautiful small format printer for my studio. Finally after seeing the R3000 at WPPI this year, I just had to have one! I print high quality prints for my fine art studio, the R3000 really prints clean, crisp and unparalleled quality right out of the box. I'm just about to add some ICC profiles and I'm finding that to be a slight bump but nothing major I'm sure. I can't say anything negative on the product. Don't hesitate and it's priced way under for it's output.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: The Epson r3000 produces prints that are amazing in color and accuracy. The 13 x 19 paper is the perfect size for a fine art print and Epson offers a great selection of 100% rag fine art papers. This prints are fantastic!

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Reliable; Easy To Set Up; Easy To Use; Compact Design; Durable construction
Cons: Too much ink used
I use the Epson R3000 primarily for printing photographs . Once you get the color profiles dialed in ( not to difficult ) the prints are of excellent quality. Printing panoramas from a roll is allot of fun and the results are awesome. It is an ink hog, especially if you switch between black inks. I recommend that you use the economy mode if you do allot of black switching which seems to help a little. I use a Mac Pro OS X Lion. Make sure you DO NOT use the install disc that came with the printer if you are using Lion. Go to the epson web site and follow their profile / driver install instructions. Over all I am very pleased with the printer and the prints. I just wish th ... e ink wasn't so darn expensive. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I like the wireless feature and the 9 cartridge slots. The icc profiles provide great correlation between my MacAir / Aperture and Epson Matte print. I did have trouble printing 13X 19 size and tracked this down to software / print settings. Be sure to use Super B size or A3+ size when printing 13X19. These metric settings are essentially equal to 13X19 paper and work in all cases. The 13X19 setting is problematic, depending upon OS, driver version, Aperture Version. Also, for LIon users: the installation instructions are confusing. Just plug the printer into the system and do a software update or printer install from the Apple website. There is a separate driver for USB and for 802.11

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Prints but uses a lot of ink
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Set Up; Easy To Use; Reliable
Cons: Slow Print Time; Too much ink used
This printer I great! I also love the option of printing directly on the compact disc! The print quality is also very beautiful given that you use the paper recommended for the printer. My only complaint would be print time and the ink! Every time you switch from Photo Black ink to Matte Black ink it waste alot of ink cleaning the nozzles.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: good print quality but LCD is useless and very poor resolution, why did they bother with putting an LcD? WiFi reciever is EXTREMELY poor. I lost lots of ink and 10 sheets of premium paper due to the printer dropping the connection after 90% of the print was complete. Epson took 5 months to send my rebate check. overall good print quality but terrible build quality, poor connectivity and poor interface. I should have gone with Canon

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: We purchased this printer for several reasons, one of them, to be able to print on CDs. Our CDs look professionally made, very happy. Had to make last minute business cards for something and it accepted a heavy card stock - the cards look great. Photos are fabulous. One drawback is the 9 ink cartridges at 33.00/piece. Didn't realize this till after we purchased. It could have been a deal breaker had we known but going to live with it now.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Good Color Match to calibrated monitor
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Easy To Set Up; Durable construction
Cons: Large Footprint
I have been fairly impressed at how well the printer image matches my monitor (after quite a bit of manual calibration work - I'm too cheap and too infrequent use to pay for hardware calibration tool). Monitor is fairly good (HP ZR24w) so I'd hoped for good match and overall am surprised at how well color calibration works. The printed image is just a little darker w/ a little less contrast vs. the screen, but colors look very accurate.
I use Lightroom and let LR manage color using Epson profile to match the paper I'm using. I downloaded LR 4 with soft proof which looks like a great feature, the soft proof for printer/paper I use looks just a little darker and lower contrast so I'm hoping t ... he result using soft proof will be even closer.
Pretty amazing for an amateur to get results this good (now if only my photos were better....). expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Easy to set up. Prints beautiful color and B&W prints. Very nice printing on all paper including standard office paper and premium glossy. I have not tried any art papers as yet however I'm sure I'll be pleased.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Printer gives beautiful detail, great color reproduction and many fine art paper options. However it is essential to update the printer driver and have the correct ICC profiles for the paper/media type.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Reliable; Fast Print Time; Low Ink Consumption; Durable construction; Easy To Set Up
Cons: None that I can find
The black & whites that I'm able to produce through this printer are spectacular. I like high contrast prints but I'm amazed at the mid-tones that this printer can produce. The color prints are pretty spectacular too. I try to use Epson Exhibition Fibre paper for all my prints. I love the dated look to the paper and to acheive the best printing results make sure that you download the ICC paper profiles from Epson.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Previously had an Epson 2800 that bit the dust. It was an ink guzzler and we had to physically replace the photo black ink with matte black for some projects. The R3000 is a much better design and gives us beautiful prints.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I am still working to learn more about what this printer could do but I have been happy with its print quality so far. I still need get familiar with all the settins to get the optimal resuts. It runs quietly and has met my expection. With $200 rebate, that's a deal.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Easy setup and start - very quiet
Item.Review: Semi-professional photographer. Have only used a few times to test quality. Blues and grays come out great, however, some photos show too much black and are too dark. Have tried with and without color management and results did not vary. Appears to use a fair amount of ink for even small size prints.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: The pictures we've printed are professional-grade. Pictures are clear and totally true to the image on the screen. As warned, it prints slowly. Good things come to those who wait.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Excellent right out of the box
Item.Review: I have been wanting to print my pictures after all these years. Used to develop and loved the creative aspects of getting to a great print. But after a while I would get a rash in my arms - allegies to the chemicals. Tried printing about twelve years ago but technology was not there. I am happy to report that it is there now - beautiful B&W's, beautiful colors. And i just got started and trying to make time. Luckily I have many pictures which I took with a print in mind. Recommend Epson 3000 very highly if you like to create and give beautiful prints. The process for settings was a little confusing at first but no sweat. Thumbs up to Epson for the printers, papers, ink tech that allows such gorgeous results. Long live the print!!

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Reliable; Durable construction; Fast Print Time; Easy To Set Up; Easy To Use
wish ink wasn't so expensive, but this machine makes gorgeous prints. I had still been using my 2000p, so a huge, huge difference. would have opted for the larger machine if I realized it was on sale for less than $1000.00, but this will do until the next generation or next large print sale

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: While I use a lab for most of my printing, the desire has been growing on me to learn the ins and outs of inkjet printing, and the hefty rebate offered on the R3000 in November 2011 was the right incentive to buy. This printer comes with clear and easy-to-follow instructions for unpackaging and installing ink cartridges, and once that was done it was recognized without problems by my operating system (Ubuntu Linux 11.04). The ICC profiles provided by Canson for the paper I bought worked as expected. Colors are accurate, print quality is indistinguishable from silver-emulsion paper, and the Canson Infinity paper I chose was handled with no trouble at all. I'm still figuring out the Advanced B&W Photo mode; my initial attempts did not quite match the best silver prints I have, but I'm ... sure that's merely a matter of experience. I look forward to much more printing with my R3000. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: We have a small design/production studio on campus. This will be a great addition to our arsenal of printers. It fills the gap between color printers and our large format printers. Quality and color are great!

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use
Cons: Too much ink used
My 2200 finally died and I replaced it with this. The print quality is much better and the K2 inks are archival so they won't fade over time. The machine is very large but it is whisper quiet and tack sharp. Best money I've spent in a while.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I bought this printer to replace an Epson R1800. I use it for prints to hang on my wall as well as print greeting cards, etc. It was very easy to set up and I was printing in no time. It produces beautiful images, discernibly better than the 1800. My only complaint is the amount of black ink it consumes as it switches between Matte & Photo black. Because of this I will be trying to limit my printing to matte paper as much as possible (my preference, anyway) to limit the usage.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I am suddenly making gorgeous 13x19 prints on art paper . They look like they've been printed on a press. I've been using a very old printer for years and had no idea what I was missing. I was able to set this printer up myself in a very short time and begin printing all sizes of prints right away. It is beautifully designed. I am worried about how often I'll need to replace cartridges and the cost, but for now, imagine it will be worth it. PV

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Waiting for Epson to replace my printer, the printer heads didn't work straight out of the box, after a week Epson will be replacing a brand new printer out of the box. Once I receive the new one maybe I'll write a better review. I will admit Epson reperasentatives have been very cooperative even when i haven't been easy to work with.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I am a photographer who has now taken this hobby to the next level by printing my own work. I love black and white photography and the Epson Stylus R3000 is my answer. I had purchased a well known printer and was disappointed with its color as well as black and white. THe Epson gave me excellent black and white, shadows, contrasts and true to my photograph. I had to play around with the color pictures. I found the pictures were darker than my original pictures. At first I explored the monitor color settings but learned a PC has 2.2 gammas verses the MAC 1.8. I was told to contact HP to see if I could change the gamma to 1.8. Not sure if this is really the problem but will investigate. In the meantime, I allow Lightroom to be my source of color and turn off the color format for the ... Epson. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Wonderful prints and Black & White photographs. Great performance overall! The only inconvenience is that you need to change the setting for matt or glossy black which can affect your ink consumption.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: The printer is slow to print
Item.Review: It is above average for the inkjet printers that are currently available. Probably inkjet printers that cost several thousand dollars would make my Epson R3000 printer look like a toy.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Easy to follow set up instructions. Using paper from my old, defunct printer company and the prints were excellent. Epson paper even better. Lives up to it's hype.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I love travel photography and this printer creates beautiful prints. It was extremely easy to set up and accomodates a wide variety of excellent papers. I just wish the Epson ink was more affordable. Even though the machine now houses both the photo black and matt black inks, when swtiching from one to the other, it appears that I lose about 1/4 of an ink tank (equates to about $6 ink loss) due to the feed line purge every time I switch inks.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: We justified spending what we did on this printer because in the long run, it will save us on outside printing costs when we can do most jobs in-house. Our first print job was on roll paper, it came out just as good as anything we could have gotten from professional print houses. We paid about thirty something for the roll paper and the one job would have cost us a hundred and twenty five to print at a print house. Within the next six months the printer will pay for itself.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: I am impressed by this printer!
Item.Review: As an amateur photographer and use this printer to make prints of my photography shoots, weddings, outdoor, family, nature and anything else that happens to pass in front of my camera. This printer produces some of the best prints that I have ever printed - outstanding! It was easy to set up and get running even for a technically challenged person like myself. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Epson R3000 Stylus Printer to anyone & everyone

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Fantastic that makes great looking realistic prints. The printer is quite expensive, both in the purchase cost and the maintenance cost, which is primarily ink. I justified it with the time and energy I take in to taking the pictures and then adjusting in lightroom. I've printed both color and B&W, 4x6 Snapshots and 8x10s, Glossy and Matte with papers from Ilford, Epson, Moab and RedRiver and all of the prints turn out great. I recommend getting a monitor calibration device and then buying the sample packs of paper from Epson, Moab etc. printing a montage that represents your typical work with a good dynamic range and really test the printers.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Just beginning to dabble in digital art - coming from the darkroom. Will use for some alternative type of digital printing other than just photographs. Color is fabulous! And, easy to use when setting up a print. One thing I'd like is to be able to use paper other that 13x19 when printing from the back. The printer will only let me use 13x19 poster board or what the printer deems is poster board. Other than that wonderful printer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Love this printer. I upgraded from an older Epson 2200. It was so easy to set up (wirelessly). Paper profiles work perfectly out of the box with Photoshop for image printing. I highly recommend it.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I'm using the printer with a MacBook Pro and an HP PC. Canon 5Dii and L lenses and Colormunki. Unpacking and set up took only minutes. The instructions are clear, complete and easy to understand. The instructions can also be downloaded. This is my first professional grade printer, and only my second printer. The R3000 performed without a flaw or problem. The printing process seemed unusually quiet, and I believe there are some energy benefits to this printer. After reading the reviews in B+H and my research, I was torn between this and the SP 4900. They are both on the cutting edge of technology and both are Epsons. I came to the conclusion that there is no real wrong decision, just different. For financial reasons I chose the R3000, and the amount of printing I do. As for qua ... lity of the print, I can only compare it to the prints I got from my 2 1/4 film cameras. The prints are stunning. No remorse or regrets, I'd buy it again. P.S. Buy extra ink because you'll love to print expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Print wedding, family gathering, children event pictures. A lot of 5X7 prints. Quality of prints is a step up from other printer and photo services. Can easily see difference in prints; they are so much better. The black & white increase in quality is shocking - it is exhibit show quality. Find myself now saving pictures by converting them to black & white; you know the the good shots where there are too many contrasts (white dress/black tux/video camera lights/sun ray peeks out/ some clown waves his hand into a corner of your shot just when the shutter clicks/ half of the people in the picture are sunburned) - the kind of shots no camera can make but Lightroom and the R3000 can save, crop and capture in black & white. This is a professional printer. It requires Epson ... paper or quality paper equal to Epson's recommended paper (what is on sale is not going to work very well - I tried it ). Reset my camera, computer, printer, drivers, Lightroom 3.4, I mean everything (?), to Adobe RBG colors; what I see is on my computer screen is what I print. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I use the printer to print direct to DVD and CD as well as reproducing B/W photo scans. It's a great addition to my business with professional quality printing and a very user friendly operation.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: This printer prints awesome prints (hence the one star), but (1) cannot print borderless, and (2) paper has to be fed by hand, one page at a time, or else the paper gets misalligned. I only used the back paper feeder but was enough to made me send the printer back to B&H for refund. I never had this problem with my old Epson 2200, which I had to replace because because Epson does not provide printer profiles, because the printer is old and the profiles are not updated to work with new computer software.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: A High End Printer Without a High Pric
Item.Review: I've had this printer for a little over a week now and I couldn't be happier with what I got for my money. It was really easy to install and the quality of the print is fantastic. I'm a graphic designer and I bought this so I could proof my own jobs before they go to print. So far, I've found my proofs to be incredibly accurate with very little effort. It was lower in cost than I expected to spend so I am very happy. I wouldn't have liked being able to print at 24 wide instead of 13 but the cost was over my budget. I haven't tried any specialty papers but that's not really what I bought it for.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: This is an extraordinary printer. My NEC monitor was callibrated and the Epson printer profiles added, and the images on Epson Hot Press Bright Smooth Matte are terrific! They match the monitor image perfectly.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I bought this printer to make photos for gallery exhibits and for sale. The prints are vivid and sharp with fine gradations of color. I've been tracking ink usage and I ran out of the yellow ink first after printing the equivalent of 25.5 12x18 prints. Estimating the amount of the other ink cartridges used, I estimate that $7.32 worth of ink was used for each 12x18 print. Adding the cost of paper, this means that the direct material cost of each 12x18 print is between $8 and $10 depending on the type of paper. While this cost may seem excessive, comparing the to the cost of having prints made at a professional printing company, which is from $35 to $50 per print, the breakeven point (including the cost of the R3000) where printing with the R3000 is less that the cost of having prints pro ... fessional printed is in the order of 20 to 30 12x18 prints. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I own a 1400 and r2400 and needed something a bit better. This will do borderless odd sizes and cards - the ink seems to go quickly, but perhaps it's just me messing with my new toy

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Buy and you will not Disappointed
Item.Review: Easy to setup out of the box. Great features including the ability to print on CDs and DVDs. Wireless setup was a breeze to setup and use. The color prints are fantastic!! BW look like it came from a darkroom. Also a straight thru path for thicker media like poster board.. Really nice build and quality feel, does not feel like cheap plastic printers of the past. Possibly the best Epson or any printer for 13 paper that can be purchased anywhere. In the past i have spent thousands on printers in the past.. with this purchase being the absolute best printer yet

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I'm a painter and develop work from modified photographs that give me a sense of where I can take my paintings. I previously owned the R2400 which I loved until the day it died. The R3000 has a larger casing and an added ink well. The cartridges are larger and more expensive. I've only been printing on this new printer for 1 1/2 weeks so time will tell more. The quality of the prints are excellent and I like the new features. The only comment that's less than a 5 star would be about the ink usage and cost of cartridges. I printed one 5x7 photo with a large expanse of black in the image using the Photo Black ink on glossy paper and the ink level indicator went down noticeably. So I'm concerned about the expense and amount of ink used.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Prints are beautiful once you get past the problems. Bug 1: On day one, printing from CS5, to the networked R3000, consistent Printer does not exist errors were becoming quite frustrating. A call to Epson support just added to the frustration when they told me they never heard of the problem. A Google search netted multiple hits and a workaround, just make the R3000 your default printer. If that bug is common knowledge on the net, why doesn't Epson support know about it? Bug 2: The driver defaults to 8.5 x 11 paper size. If you are not paying attention and have smaller paper loaded, the printer will happily feed the smaller paper and still print an 8.5 x 11 image spraying ink all over it's internals. No error is generated. This is the first Epson printer I have bought that didn't inclu ... de some paper samples. There also are no cables included. Only one size of roll paper is supported, 13 inch. Nevertheless, as stated earlier, the prints are quite nice and I do look forward to working with this printer. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Fantastic prints right out of the box. The b/w printing is a massive improvement over the R1900. I can't wait to see what it's capable of when I've created my own icc profiles. Still too soon to give 5 stars, but it's very close at this time.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I bought the Epson Stylus R3000 Printer to print my watercolor scans. I was worried they wouldn't be close enough to the original but I was wrong...it's so amazing, the first print I did (pictured below), my family couldn't tell the difference between the original and the print. Love, Love this!!It's so easy to setup and use...so easy!Originally, I was going to buy the R2880, because of the great reviews, but after researching a bit I found that the R3000 was wireless and had larger ink cartridges. I was sold. It was a bigger investment but with Epson's [$]rebate it was more affordable. (R2880 is [$]rebate)I do have to say the ink kinda scares me, it's [$]to replace all cartridges BUT not enough to scare me off. The quality is tooooo good to worry about ink costs.A note: This printer is BI ... G, make sure you have a place for it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: You get what you pay for!!!
Item.Review: I paid a lot and got a lot. A printer that can print near perfect b and w prints in a wide format. I print fine art photos for salon sales. I had used a r2400 since 2006 and expect the r3000 to exceed the quality and durability. I am a happy Epson customer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: My 6th Epson and still the best!!
Item.Review: Two photographers use the R3000 via wireless with Mac and Windows operating systems. There are a total of five computers in the household at various locations and all are primarily used for digital imaging with Photoshop.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: My printer arrived at my home in great condition in the time limit given by B&H. Although the printer is large and somewhat heavy, it took little effort to set my R3000 up and install the drivers and cartridges. I was able to start printing photos soon after installation and WOW, does it print beautiful photos or what!! I am having a little difficulty adjusting the photos for borderless appearance, but this will come as I get used to it. I feel like I will be spending more for ink, but in return I'll be producing beautiful prints. I have no regrets about purchasing this Epson printer, even though the learning curve is quite involved and complex. It does print slowly, but I'm a patient person, and I can live with it-to get the kind of prints it produces.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: We bought this for the Black and White prints. Very happy with the results...except that it really uses up the ink, specially when changing from matt to photo black. Seems a bit slow when priinting fine images.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I bought this printer to replace my R2400. The R3000 is a great printer that produces truly spectacular prints. However, I printed my portfolio book on this printer and was not satisfied with the results. My book has double sided Moab Lasal paper. When printing the front of the page all is great. When I flip the print over to print on the back the rollers in the printed leave two stripes on the front print. It is most obvious in the solid, dark areas but none-the-less the stripes are very noticable. When printing on my R2400 this is not an issue. Although the R3000 makes wonder prints and is very usuer friendly I returned the printer because of the issues with printing double sided paper.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I use this primarily to make archival art prints of my wife's and my work. We have been doing this for over 10 years and previously used an Epson 2200. The R3000 is a huge improvement. The front feed feature is particularly useful when using relatively thick print stock.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I spend a lot of time and effort taking photographs and I wanted a printer that would provide profession quality prints for framing for both personal use and to give as gifts to friends and family. I love this printer. I couldn't ask for better print reproduction of my photos!! My previous printer did an okay job, but the results from this are truly amazing!!

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I spent years in the traditional darkroom settings getting tones just the way I wanted them. Along comes digital and, whether your scanning film or printing straight from digital capture, this printer is capable of stunning output. Just make certain that your monitor is calabrated and you have quality output software (Lightroom is fantastic). My prints have been spot on with practically no trial and error. I have read other reviews (other sites) stating that the wireless capabilities are useless as the printer slows to a crawl. This is not the case at all. This printer is fast???even set to maximum resolution printing (although the spool time is extended a bit). Fast is a relative word, but in comparison to other printers I have owned this one is impressive. I have no reservations giving ... this product the highest of recommendations...Stunning, archival prints with nothing more than an iMac and the R3000. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: The last photo printer I had was an HP 8750 and while good, it wasn't the best. This printer goes well beyond the HP in color fidelity and clarity. I'm currently using Ilford Smooth Pearl paper and some others I haven't tried yet, but I'll be using the SP as my normal paper since I love the results. I'll be printing a ton with this thing and can't wait to try some of the fine art papers as I know the results will be outstanding.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Right out of the box, this was excellent. I plugged it into a wireless printserver via an ethernet and installed the software. The software found the printer, even through a router to the printserver and it worked first time, perfectly. Used LightRoom 3 to control printing a 13x19 paper and it came out beautiful. heprint is being framed right now. If you need 11x17 or 13x19, this is the printer you want!

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Set Up; Easy To Use; Reliable; Photo quality prints; Durable construction; Fast Print Time
Cons: Large Footprint
Had used an Epson R1800 for a long time with no problems. Read about the R3000's improvements and quality, so I gambled...and won. The R1800 was great, but the R3000 is superb! True, ink is more expensive, but cartridges contain three times more than those of the R1800 and show a marked difference in tone, intensity, and reproducing beautiful pictures!

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast Print Time; Easy To Use; Easy To Set Up; Reliable
Changed over from an older printer that I thought I was happy with.....The R3000 blows me away with the clarity and color it prints. I can see a marked difference and the prints definitely look professional in quality.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I don't have anything to say about the quality of my new R3000, replacing an excellent R1900 that was a nice printer also. But let's talk about the inks.On the third print, my printer get a message, cartridges red crossed blinking and asked to me to stop and restart the power, due to a bad paper insertion on the fine art path. Then it did a cleanup and drunk 60% of the ink ... Nice [$] print! i am just amazed that when we crash a paper, there is no issue on the software and that half of the ink just goes away. I just want that people know that it s not on the printer that they earn money but on this liquid gold... that is so nice about you Epson!And no the Fine Art path is not easy. If you follow the messages on the board, they neevr say t ... hat we must press back on the trail once the paper is positionned.NExt time i will see Canon solution or HP. Sorry but my last Epson. I wanna stop to feed the ones who are not enough careful with the users and hook them with the supplies. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: It is a good printer, however!
Item.Review: I use this printer as an all purpose unit like I did with my Canon i9900 which quit working as a photo printer after 7 years. It still worked as a plain paper printer but that wasn't enough. This Epson printer is slow compared to my old Canon printer for printing photographs but the quality is very good (better than the Canon). There is one issue however. Different types of media require you to switch from one type of black ink to another type which can become annoying after a while. Otherwise this printer is a joy to own.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: When my Epson R2400 died after 5 years of much use, I decided to move up to the R3000. The main reason I chose this printer was because both matte black and photo (glossy) black cartridges were in the printer lineup and you didn't have to switch them out every time you wanted to change papers. As for the printer itself it worked perfectly right out of the box, print quality is noticeably better than prints from the R2400, and I haven't even begun to customize settings. I also like the LED screen in front that tells you what's going on instead of having to guess.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I have been printing on Red River Aurora Natural Rag paper for almost a month now. with almost no problems. Prints look gorgeous. Here are a few minor flaws: 1. The paper mentioned above will not auto feed in the autofeeder. not sure if I can fix that with some driver setting... right now i feed one sheet at a time through the autofeeder. 2. At first, there seemed to be quite a bit of adjusting by the printer. And I don't mean the ink-loading noises. even a few days after I started using it, there were quite a few pauses in output, accompanied by pump noises... The printer is now quiet. I hope there is nothing wrong with it.. A little more feedback on what it's doing would be nice. Overall, I am very happy with the prints and that's what matters!

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Durable construction; Reliable; Easy To Set Up
I needed a second photo printer to complement, if not, to replace my Canon 9500 Mark II. The Epson Stylus R3000 is a great printer so far, I haven't had any problems yet. This printer has a good quality print and is somewhat quiet and fast. I use it for my photography business and is already the printer of choice.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Recommended, yes. But, U need to READ
Item.Review: After a few weeks; Great printer. However, you MUST learn about color management (what the difference between perceptual and relative colormetric is; what color space your camera is set to, what color space the printer is set to; how to calibrate your monitor, etc. If you don't take the time, you will be frustrated. Not something you can plug & play with. Take the time to learn, and you will be happy.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I needed a smaller printer than my R3880 to have in my Florida condo. This really fits the bill and feels just like the 3880. The bonus is that it also uses roll paper for great panoramas which the 3880 does not. I love both of these printers and would recommend them to anyone.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Easy Set Up. High Quality Prints.
Item.Review: The R3000 is a snap to set up. I had it producing excellent prints in less than a hour. The feed seems to be improved over previous models. Makes beautiful professional prints that are every bit as good as the pro 3880. My only gripe is a familiar one - the ink consumption is rather high although due to the higher capacity cartridges I get a higher yield than with the 2880. If you produce and sell a lot of prints, you are better off with a 3880 if you can afford the initial cost.I have not tried the front loading feature yet but it looks like it will be more convenient than other models. Build features on the R3000 are excellent and the black & white printing capability is outstanding although the interface is not as sophisticated as on the 3880. All in all the R3000 is a solid machine ... . expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: The printer works more or less precisely as advertised. I am using it in combination with the Moab Infinity 300 gsm inkjet-prepared whitened watercolor paper to produce giclee-grade fine art prints. I do not have any hesitation signing the output and selling it as giclee; color range and fidelity is extraordinarily high, contrast is excellent, and consistency of printing is reliable. The printer operates more quickly via USB than airport. Recommended as a good option for artists who don't need to print wider than 13 and want to be able to offer giclee prints without trekking back and forth to a print shop charging high rates to deploy the same technology in the wider-printing Epson pro line.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Big, but it Prints Beautiful Large Print
Item.Review: When I received it, I thought my God, this thing is huge. But when I found a good place for it and set it up, it performed well. I had really old paper, so the prints were just OK, so I bought Epson Ultra Premium Photo Paper, 11.7 X 16.5, and the quality of the large prints knocked by socks off. It is wireless, which is a plus for me. It also handles 4X6 easily as well. The only complaint that I have and it may be a user learning curve issue is on the large prints, there was a slight miss on the borders - easily correctible through a paper cutter or a frame with a slightly smaller matte box.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Epson pre-sales tech told me the new R3000 solved the problems with the 2880 and 3880 not being able to handle fine art paper such as Hahnemuhle Museum Etching paper. Out of the box I've now ruined six costly sheets trying to get the printer to feed. The special front slot for thick paper has no guides, and chews both the ends and sides of the paper and it invariably jams. Not a serious printer. I'll try the Canon 13.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: The Epson Stylus Photo R3000 is the best photo printer I've used by far. I wanted to duplicate a school photo of my 6 yr old niece. I had both a physical and email copy. The photo was originally done on a Luster type paper and I was able to duplicate it almost perfectly on Moab Fiber Satine. I've never put so little effort in printing a photo before. Although the printer is a little slow (hence the 4 stars), it was well worth the wait.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: The next step in archival color printers
Item.Review: I got this as a replacement for an Epson 2200. As such, it is a distinct improvement over the previous machine. The larger ink cartridges and color screen make it much easier to use. It is still not very fast but speed isn't why you chose a printer like this. The color rendition and resolution is excellent. Only time will tell about the color lasting but I susbect it will be good like the 2200.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: best printer i have had yet
Item.Review:
Pros: Durable construction; Fast Print Time; Easy To Set Up; Compact Design; Easy To Use; Reliable; Great prints
Love this printer,easy to set up ,wireless is wonderful I can put it anywhere and it works ,it is very quiet and the prints are fantastic

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I'd been using the Epson 2200 for about 9 years and, despite a recent overhaul by Epson, it was starting to show its age. The new Epson R3000 was the natural replacement and I ordered one from B&H to see how technology has advanced in the approximately 10 years since the 2200 was introduced. The answer is, not surprisingly, a lot. Set-up was relatively easy. There's a considerable wait (about 10 minutes) while the printer primes itself with its first set of ink cartridges, but there's no work to do; the printer happily tends to itself in this regard. Driver installation (Windows 7, 64-bit) is straightforward. When printing the new R3000 is much quieter than the 2200; there's much less clatter and the printer sounds and feels much more solidly constructed. The overall impression is o ... f a very well-made printer. We'll see how it holds up with use. My biggest hope is that it's less prone to head clogging between uses. My printing is generally of large photographic prints for sale and exhibit. I've found that for really critical printing it's best to use custom profiles, especially when using non-Epson papers. After making profiles for my preferred Ilford Gold Fibre Silk paper I ran a few test prints and the results were outstanding. Black and white printing, with the R3000's 3 black inks, is the best I've seen from an inkjet. The only glitch so far is what appears to be a head strike towards the end of one 13 x 19 print. Perhaps this is due to the thickness of the Gold Fibre Silk paper and using the front-load system for the paper will cure it but I didn't think the Ilford paper was really thick enough to require this. Further testing will tell. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: The images almost jump off the page!
Item.Review: The Epson R3000 replaced an over-the-hill Epson R2400. The R3000 will be used primarily for photos. Although some ink will be lost from glossy to matte, I like having all of the K3 inks available without cartridge swaps. I print all my images from Lightroom 3; the color management is very straightforward. I am really looking forward to printing a 13 X 19 or larger image. I recommend the Epson R3000.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I have made about 6 prints with this printer and am very impressed. I am especially impressed with it's ability to produce full range b&w prints. Now I know 6 prints isn't very many so this is a first impressions review. I showed a couple of these prints to a digital printer I know and he was impressed as well. Set up was quite easy and intuitive. As far as printing goes, make sure you specify the correct paper before printing (glossy, luster, etc.). My main reason for buying this printer was to print b&w and it looks like I won't be disappointed. It does go through a long warm up cycle when I turn it on which begs the question, How much ink it is wasting? I haven't found an answer to this question yet.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I have just upgraded from the R2400 printer, which I was very happy with. The problem was that I had difficulty using Velvet Fine Arts paper. The R3000 has resolved that problem and now I'm even more happy. It is excellent for both B&W and color printing.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I've had my Epson R3000 for about a month. This was a replacement for my Epson R2400 which had given me inconsistent results. Indeed, an Epson rep confided to me that the R2400 was rushed to market and gave many people troubles in printing. My R3000 was intended as a replacemnt. Initially, I had good quality prints and then out of the blue began to have problems with it. I've spent hours on the phone with Epson technical support trouble shooting and going through color management process. I may not be a computer genuis but I feel I am smart enough to get this product to work. It doesn't, and I am ending my long unhappy relationship with Epson and will replace with a Cannon which I should have done long ago.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Use at home for printing photographs and some other general printing. I have had the printer a month and everything is great so far. Delivery was right on time with all the paper work for the rebate. Installation could not have been easier. I am using the wireless connection on multi computers. It was very easy and has not failed once. So far nothing to complain about. Thanks

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Like being back in the darkroom!
Item.Review: I've only had the R3000 for two weeks, but have already found that it has me remembering what fun it was being in the darkroom and being able to handle a photographic project from inception to final print. I had held out purchasing an ink-jet printer for many years until I recently had some prints made on an Epson at a local gallery. I was very impressed with the quality and decided to take the plunge. I am SO happy I did. I love the complete control over my images. The Epson produces wonderful results. I have been matting and framing them for an upcoming art show and know that they will be a hit!

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: An AMAZING printer for the price
Item.Review: This ink jet printer incorporates advanced technology that produces high quality prints. This printer uses 9 inks and produces finer droplet sizes which enables the printer to create better tonal gradations and color nuances.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Initial Review of Epson Photo R 3000 Ptr
Item.Review: I've only had this a short while. I bought it as a replacement for my aging HP Photosmart 7960. The color is great and with some calibrating (Datacolor Spyder3 Studio SR)got great color match results. It would be rated a five but it goes through ink like a race horse drinking water in the desert, and at $233 + to replace all the cartridges it can be an expensive aquisition.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Not as good as the R1900
Item.Review: I regret to have upgraded my printer from the R1900 to the R3000. With the R1900, I did not have to worry about the kind of black ink I was using, the printer took care of that without me noticing or having to do anything, the printer selected the black ink, photo or matt according to the media used. With the R3000 you get a message asking you if you want to change the ink, then after lot of noises and time, you will notice how the printer drinks the black ink before you print anything. The software is not as good as in the R1900, it is more directed to non-thinking minds. Being the R3000 just below the pro line, the software should be more targeted for people with mind that enjoy the photographic experience from taking the photo to printing it.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Moved up from one of the all in one printers from Epson to this large format printer. [...], the software installation took a few minutes, calibration of the monitor, and later my first test print - all fast and the printer output is exceptional. Configured printer for USB interface and the printer has been working flawlessly.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: All that I wanted and more
Item.Review: I purchased this printer because I was having problems matching the color as viewed on the screen as to what I was getting printed. I have 2other HP's and another epson. I set the printer up and printed a photograph using windows. The color matched perfectly and I was able to finish my project that day. I highly recommend the product.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Epson R3000 - great wide format printer
Item.Review: I have only had this printer for a short time. I'm moving from an Epson R800. Looking forward to the wide format capability. [...] Set-up was easy. I am waiting for some high-end paper sample packs from Epson and Red River for more testing. The prints that I have made so far (on Epson Premium Photo Paper (Glossy)) are very nice. I used the printer managed color so far. I have not done any B&W prints yet, but am looking forward to them.As I get some more prints done I will update my review.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Upgraded my HP PhotoSmart to the R3000 and am very happy with the results. Even low-res image look great at 11 x 14. Subtle color and punchy B&W. I feel like I'm back the darkroom watching each image with excitement as it trundles out of the printer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Awesome printer especially with the wireless capability. The ink consumption for switching between photo and matt black seems excessive. Epson should work on the black ink issue since this is a comment from many users.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I am an amature photographer and stepped up to quality pro equipment. The print quality is really fantastic on the few things I have printed so far. I really like the black and white feature of the printer, that is my main reason for the purchase of this printer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: For anybody that is upgrading from the R1800/R1900 - I would caution that they think things thru very carefully whether the R2000 (vice R3000) is more suitable for them. Make no mistake - the R3000 prints beautiful color (glossy) photos! The issue is the amount of ink you waste in switching to do B&W - and then switching back. If you are a predominantly color (glossy) user - the R3000 is probably not the best choice. For occasional (and non-exhibition grade) B&W printing, I recommend the R2000 (it can switch between photo/matte black inks without flushing/charging the black ink line because it has dedicated separate lines for each). Two small gripes: (1)if you forget to open up the print output door in front - the printer keeps right on pushing the paper thru until it scrunches u ... p the paper inside and ruins the print. (2) Epson should have designed the printer with separate ink lines for black matte/photo to prevent significant ink wastage in flushing out and then charging the single line. You will definitely NOT want to switch back-and-forth! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Works out of the box; Easy To Use; Excellent Print Quality
Cons: Pricey Replacement Ink; Hard Setup
I bought this when my HP wide format printer would no longer print jobs sent through our Ethernet network. The Epson has a built-in Ethernet port and worked right out of the box with the network. Setting up the printer was a bit more work than some. The printer is huge. The ink tanks are quite small so it will require fairly frequent replacement. All in all I'm quite satisfied.
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Don't think twice about buying this!
Item.Review: I use this printer for my photography and my artwork and I can't be more pleased. In-line photo black and matte black ink switching is a BIG deal for me. The only complaint I have is Epson designed this to except poster-board up to 1.22mm thick but they don't make the poster-board. I called Epson three times and searched on line and no one in the paper business makes a 13 x 19 poster-board (I need to make signage from time to time it would be nice). You will be blown away with the output from the Epson R3000 don't think twice if your in the market for a new or upgrade desktop printer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Photo R3000 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: This printer replaced my Epson 2000 which worked well for 10 years. This printer is fast, great color, and does borderless prints in a variety of sizes. I printed several large prints using the multi-page option. I was amazed that I could create a 4-foot by 6-foot picture using 16 Super-B borderless prints with no cutting, the pannels fit together perfectly. The first few ink cartridges ran out after about 25 Super-B prints (13 by 19).
